[h1] Квантовый стимпанк или  вкусная сюжетная каша [/h1]

Итак, игра пройдена. Что оставит она после себя? Безусловно многое, но все ли так великолепно? 
Игра однозначно отличная: атмосферная, музыкальная, увлекательная, содержательная. Но она хуже чем первый Биошок во всем, за исключением Элизабет.

[u]Достоинства:[/u]
1. Атмосфера. Мир хочется исследовать, его хочется понять. В игре много деталей и контента. От фонограмм и диафильмов до челенджевых карт "битвы в облаках".
2. Увлекательный геймплей. Игровая механика неплохая, хотя и хуже чем в первом Биошоке.
3. Музыкальное сопровождение. Без замечаний. Джаз также хорош, но в Фаллаут он встраивается гармоничнее.
4. Элизабет. Именно она и делает эту игру. До ее появления в игре, скучаешь и не понимаешь причину выхода этой игры. Но она все меняет. Один из лучших женских персонажей компьютерных игр за все время. Она вносит необычные особенности геймплея. Такого не было нигде.
5. Неплохие DLC. BS Ep1 мне понравился больше основной истории.
6. Достижения и коллекционные карточки Steam присутсвуют.

[u]Недостатки:[/u]
1. Сюжет. Путешествия во времени + паралельные миры = каша. В первом Биошоке был хороший самодостаточный сюжет, оригинальный продуманный сеттинг. Для чего было разрывать мир на части и не оставлять для игрока ничего? Игрока мотает между мирами и временем, даже многочисленные фонограммы, которые я почти все переслушал на 3 раза, не помогают найти в этом мире свое место.
2. Ролевая составляющая - хуже чем в оригинале. Неинтересные апгрейды оружия и перки для галочки.
3. Неинтерактивное окружение. Настолько неинтерактивное, что отверстия в стекле "заживают", а тела врагов быстро исчезают. Вспоминается старый добрый NES, где тело мигало 3 раза и исчезало.
4. Скайлайн в шутере без ног это как последняя модель Форда Мустанга, который застрял между мирами. Впрочем, все сходится! :)

Итого: достоинства в целом перевешивают недостатки.
[b] Моя оценка: 8 из 10. [/b]

So much potential feels to have been wasted here, the whole game feels like one long railroad. 

 I suspected something was off after only the first ten minutes of play when, despite good initial impressions, we are given no real clue as to our character’s motivation.  Instead they are revealed gradually over the first three hours of game play, giving the player little in terms of investment in the character’s plight.  There is little in terms of character development either, more a slow reveal of this biography coupled with a drastic change of personality when it suited the developers to synchronise their protagonist’s actions with the likely emotions of the observer.

 By the time the player has roused suitable investment in the story at hand, we have already realised that we are merely watching a scripted production.  Every area is a set piece of a theatre, serving as padding between poorly disguised checkpoints and providing little in terms endearment for the by now stagnant game play.  Occasionally the story is deep and enthralling, but that is to its detriment, drawing attention to the less than elegant execution, the inflexible nature of the supposedly intractable world and the idiocy of our character’s decisions throughout. 

What's more, it leaves the major question unanswered; Why?

[h1] Bioshock Infinite Review[/h1]

Es passiert wirklich selten, dass mich ein Spiel fesselt und einfach nicht loslässt.
Doch Bioshock Infinite hat mich tatsächlich verleitet NonStop zu spielen, bis ich auch das letzte Stück der Story wie ein Schwamm aufgesaugt habe.

Dieses Spiel war schon lange auf meiner "to play"-Liste, doch hab ich nie wirklich zugegriffen als mir Steam die Möglichkeit gegeben hat es für unter 10€ zu kaufen. Wenn ich zurückblicke, verstehe ich wirklich nicht warum ich nicht früher zugegriffen habe, denn wie ich finde ist es sogar den unreduzierten Preis Wert.

Bioshock Infinite macht nämlich alles richtig was ich (man) von einem Ego-Shotter erwarte(t).
Die Kämpfe sind knackig und machen durch die vielzahl an Waffen und Fähigkeiten immer wieder aufs Neue Spaß.
Der Kreativität sind hier sehr breite Grenzen gesetzt und so kann sich jeder Shooter Freund austoben.

Doch definieren die Kämpfe das Spiel weniger als die Story und die allgemeine Athmospäre, denn in diesem Gebiet macht Bioshock Infinite so schnell niemand etwas vor. Es ist definitiv nicht übertrieben hierbei von einer gewissen Art von Perfektion zu sprechen. Das Spiel ist lebendich. Egal wo man hinsieht, es findet sich immer etwas was sich zu erforschen lohnt. Zu der super Grafik und dem extrem gut passenden Soundtrack, ist es die Liebe zum Detail, die dem Spiel einen besonderen Touch gibt. Die Story ist unglaublich kreativ und tiefgreifend. Je weiter man durch das Spiel vortschreitet, desto verworrener und interessanter wird es, bis man am Ende mehr oder weniger fassunglos mit offenem Mund dasteht.  

[u] Bioshock Infinite ist eine Reise.[/u]
Und der Weg das Ziel! Es ist eins dieser Spiele wo man jede Sekunde genießt und wenn es dann doch zu einem Ende kommt, mit einem lachenden und einem weinenden Auge ersteinmal durchatmen muss.

Mich hatt es tief berührt! Ich bin in der Welt von Bioshock Infinite versunken, hatte Spaß, konnte mit den Charakteren mitfühlen und war zutiefst beeindruckt.
[i]Kann ich Irgendwelche Sachen bemängeln?[/i] [b]Nein![/b]
[i]Würde ich es weiter empfehlen?[/i] [b]Zu 100%![/b]

이름에 걸맞는 바이오쇼크 프랜차이즈 시리즈의 최신작. 

전작에서 활약했던 수중도시 랩쳐는 어둡고 음습한 분위기를 풍기는 폐쇄적인 도시였다면

바이오쇼크 인피니트는 밝고 탁 트인 공중도시 콜롬비아를 배경으로 이야기가 진행된다. 

하지만 전작과 동일하게 생체의 개조를  이용한 특수 능력을 사용한다는 기믹은 유지하고 있으며

전작과 다른 주인공, 스토리 라인을 통해 바이오쇼크 시리즈를 굳이 전부 플레이 하지 않아도 얼마든지 스토리를 이해할 수 있다.

그렇다고 전작과의 접점이 없지는 않은데 그런 부분을 찾는 것도 하나의 묘미이다.

본 게임의 공중도시, 콜롬비아는 큰 비밀을 숨기고 있는 이상향으로 빚을 탕감하기 위해 한 여자를 데려오고자 방문한 부커 드윗에 의해 하나 하나 파헤쳐진다.

이야기의 진행은 스피디하며 작중의 여주인공 엘리자베스와의 관계나 SF적인 설정, 충격적인 반전은 약간의 난이도에도 불구하고 집중할 수 있게 해주는 좋은 동기부여가 된다.

인물이 등장하지 않지만 북소폰이라는 음성저장장치를 이용한 기록들을 살펴봄으로서 진행에서 미처 다 하지 못한 배경지식을 습득할 수 있는 것도 좋은 부분이다.

일부에 따라서는 (SF와 친근하지 않은 또는 싫어하는) 굉장히 이야기가 베베 꼬여있고 황당할 수 있지만 재미를 보장한다.

게임성에 대해서는 필자는 약간의 난이도를 느꼈지만 스트레스에 가까운 난이도는 아니었으며 타격감이나 액션성도 좋았다고 생각한다. 등장하는 다양한 특수능력을 조합해 전투를 입맛에 맞게 즐길 수 있고 특색있는 총기류는 플레이 스타일에 따라 업그레이드와 교체가 가능하다. 공중도시라는 설정 답게 스카이라인을 이용하여 하늘을 날아다닌다던가 공중에서 급습하는 식의 플레이가 가능하다.

다만 극 중에 등장하는 이동장치인 스카이라인을 이용한 전투가 생각보다 적고 소재는 참신했으나 그걸 쓰는 방법이 그다지 참신하지 못했다는 점이 아쉬웠다.

AI인 엘리자베스는 게임 출시 당시 굉장한 이슈가 되었을 만큼 주목받는 캐릭터로 스스로 행동하고 주인공을 서포트하며 주변의 사물과 반응하는 모습을 보여준다.

적이 등장할 경우 숨어서 전투에 도움이 되는 소금이나 탄약을 건내주기도 하고 지나가다가 발견한 동전을 던져주기도 한다. 신기한 물건이나 장소에 대해서는 스스로 조사하기도 하며 짧막한 대사도 존재한다. 또한 막힌 길의 자물쇠를 열어주는, 어찌보면 크게 쓸모있는 재능은 아니지만 해결사인 드윗이 처음 온 콜럼비아의 자물쇠를 너무나도 자연스럽게 따는 장면 보다는 골방에 틀어박혀 다양한 지식을 섭렵하면서 문도 딸 수 있게 되었다는 자연스러움을 준다.

하지만 어디까지나 프로그래밍 된 범위 내에서 행동하며 이전에 등장하던 NPC에 비해서는 분명 더 친근하게 다가오는 것이 맞으나 생각하던 만큼 자유롭게 움직이는, 스스로 사고하는 NPC는 아니라는 점은 조금 아쉽다.

그럼에도 불구하고 그런 행동을 통해 단순히 NPC가 아닌 게임에서의 한 인물로써 다가오기 때문에  게임에 더 집중하게 한다는 점은 분명한 장점이다.

그래픽은 화려하고 온화하며 전작처럼 약간 대두인 만화적인 인물으로 표현했다. 그에 따라 사실감은 조금 줄어든 대신에 고사양 쉐이더와 안티를 덕지덕지 바르지 않아도 보기 좋은 정도의 그래픽을 유지하지만 현실성은 조금 떨어지는 편.

총평을 하자면 

매우 잘 만든 게임이고 특히나 스토리 위주의 게임을 좋아한다면 더할 나위 없이 좋은 선택이다.

Bon sang que ce jeu est jouissif !
Au départ mitigé car j'étais sceptique quand au coté steampunk et mélange science / magie de Bioshock Infinite ( je précise au passage que je n'ai jamais joué aux précédents volets de la licence ), je l'ai pris à cause des nombreux avis positifs - et d'une promo de ouf ! - j'ai rapidement changé d'avis.

Ce jeu fou des claques visuelles de malade, quand on se penche sur les textures et les graphismes ils sont bons sans être au top, mais c'est cette ambiAnce*, cette couleur magnifique, ce character design. C'est parfait.

[ HS*: D'ailleurs ambiAnce s'écrit bien comme ça, et pas avec un 'e', je ne sais pas qui m'a foutu le tag "ambiEnce" mais si je l'attrape je lui arrache ses yeux, j'en fait une marmelade avec ses boyaux et je lui fait bouffer le tout ! P'tain ! ]
Edit: On dirait bien que depuis mon évaluation ça a été corrigé.

La deuxième claque que je me suis pris est en début du jeu, où après avoir découvert ce coté idyllique du jeu, celui ci me rappelle brusquement à la réalité avec une violence inattendue, presque barbare ( pov' gars avec la moitié de la tronche arrachée... Même si c'était lui ou moi ).
Par la suite rien ne déçoit, le gameplay nerveux est extremement bien réalisé, et l'idée de l'aérotram est excellente pour éviter les combats rectilignes présents dans  90% des FPS. L'histoire est excellente, bien qu'assez alambiquée par moment. Et la fin, Oh mon Dieu la fin, je spoile pas, mais c'est grandiose.
C'est génial de A à Z.

Pour les points négatifs, je parlerai de la durée, légèrement courte, et on aimerai continuer à jouer ( c'est d'ailleurs pour ça que je vais sans doute prendre le saison pass, qui rajoute pas mal de contenu ). Ainsi qu'un gros problème de difficulté.
Pour expliquer, j'avais commencer ce jeu en difficulté moyenne, mais arrivé à la moitié du jeu, je me suis rendu compte que je n'étais pas mort une fois, et qu'il n'y avait pas de véritable challenge.
J'ai donc recommencé le jeu en difficile cette fois. Et là, plus moyen de faire un pas sans prendre des coups de chaque coté, j'avançais très difficilement et mourrais fréquement. Finalement, arrivé sur un passage particulièrement difficile, et après être mort une bonne vingtaine de fois ( ouais, j'ai pas mal insisté ), j'ai du me résoudre à diminuer la difficulté en moyen. Et hop, j'ai fait ce passage sans problème avec un respawn à 50% de vie du premier coup. Voyez le problème ?

En clair, la difficulté moyenne est trop simple, ( et je vous parle pas du mode facile, faudra que je teste pour rigoler un peu ) et la difficile est vachement compliqué.

Bon voilà, tout ce que j'ai à dire après ça c'est : Go ! foncez ! C'est d'la balle !

I paid release price for this game and it's the last time I will ever do so. Even if the game dropped to $15 dollars, I still couldn't recommend it to anyone.

GAMEPLAY:
-Elisabeth, who was the star of all the ads and some revolutionary AI companion was not a crowning example of NPC companions. For all she was to the enemies, an invulnerable ghost, she may as well have been to you. Elisabeth's 'assistance' in combat is of little to no use. Never once did her abilities actually change the tide of combat nor did the items she threw make a difference, they only function as a jarring pause to combat. Whether or not she's with you made zero difference in difficulty. The turrets were, at best, something to draw fire away from you in a game where your HP was insane, and whatever she threw you always ended up interrupting the flow of combat instead of helping.

-There is zero scarcity or resource management elements to the game. Everything at all difficulties is plentiful, and your only real limitations to combat are having 2 weapon slots, so you might be poorly equipped for the job.

-The hard mode is not harder. You're simply forced to be accurate and conserve ammunition if you have a favored weapon, or drop guns to swap them out for something with more bullets once in a while. This is not difficult to adapt to. There is not an ounce of replayability in this game.

-By the time you find your first explosive weapon, the game is over. One shot obliterates anything in the room, and any sidearm of your choice will let you finish it off.

-Your character's powers are extremely underwhelming and always inferior to firearms, and in some cases, melee strikes. An entire avenue of gameplay critical to the series' identity has been neutered. Vigors are weak, useless, limited in uses, and probably need better upgrades to function as intended. The guns do not.

-"Boss battles" are recurring enemies later, with no real power spikes for the player to help defeat them easier. They're genuinely non-threatening the first time you encounter them.



STORY:

-Elisabeth is a really bad example of likable companions. She was nothing but an annoyance for the entire game, hindered, delayed, and drew out the story with moments of shallow characterization, and never did anything useful for actual gameplay. She was just a plot device serving to over-complicate a disjointed nonsensical thinly veiled Dr. Who fan-fiction, and all of her powers were huge examples of wasted potential narrative and in gameplay.

-CADbortion levels of shifting tones throughout the story.

-I bought into the epic feeling of flying around on the skyrails, not knowing the rest of the game was as linear as the tracks.

-The environments are beautiful, but they also drag you along on a very narrow path with poor obstacles to replace invisible walls, and the interactivity with the environment is almost non-existant. Level design is lacking and doesn't support the narrative at all.

-The antagonist is fought in a cut scene that, thankfully, doesn't have QTEs, but I think this might be the sole exception for where they'd be acceptable so you might feel some involvement in the story being resolved rather than feeling like you're in an out of body experience.

-The thing they expected to be a plot was so full of holes it couldn't even pass for a screen door.
 
-Imagine an eight year old trying to tell a ghost story; meandering, thoughtless, can't keep a single train of thought. The final fifteen minutes of the game is reserved for attempting to explain away all this weak writing, psuedo-philosophy, and all of the other flaws in the story, but all you get for sitting through it is an unsatisfying conclusion to the story that made all of your efforts pointless. There's no satisfaction, or resolution to the story. Only disappointment as you realized Booker's time was a waste, everything he did was for nothing, and you're left staring at the credit screen feeling the exact same way: Feeling you just wasted an entire day of your life for nothing.




FOUR YEARS LATER:
Hey, look, DLC! 
....And nothing else changed.

I REALLY, REALLY wish Steam had it's current refund policies back when I bought this game. I'd have returned it less than an hour in just due to how many times the damn thing crashed during start-up, or about half an hour after the racist section when I realized that was the pinnacle of decision-making for the entire game.

This game was fun, and it was entertaining. The art/ graphics were sweet. The game starts with setting up the world and letting the player enjoy the sites and looks of the world without forcing them run and gun around paying attention only to enemies to shoot, and I find that to be a great way to start sets the mood, sets the world up, and sets up the character in the world without pressure to do anything crazy before thrusting you into the action. Color wise you will experience all sorts of locations with different themes and colors, and by chance if you are one of those individuals that love how games look this is one of the most enjoyable parts. Game play wise its solid. It doesn't bring anything new to the table, but that wasn't the point of the game. The gameplay is tight and not hard to get use to, and it is more than just run around cover to cover shooting and hiding to heal, but you will feel powerful and will be able to take one most of what the game throws at you as long as you get creative with it. An amazing story for this game with some interesting twist and an ending that will hopefully make a person think. The only main gripe or problem is the vigors that give you your powers they are advertised to use and give everyone powers, but only see yourself running around using them not any to most of the people you fight other than special enemies.
